name: Code: The Hidden Language of Computer Hardware and Software
author: Charles Petzold
description: What do flashlights, the British invasion, black cats, and seesaws have to do with computers? In CODE, they show us the ingenious ways we manipulate language and invent new means of communicating with each other.

name: Algorithms to Live By: The Computer Science of Human Decisions
author: Brian Christian
description: A fascinating exploration of how insights from computer algorithms can be applied to our everyday lives, helping to solve common decision-making problems and illuminate the workings of the human mind

name: Python Programming: An Introduction to Computer Science
author: John Zelle
description: This is the second edition of John Zelle's Python Programming, updated for Python 3. This book is designed to be used as the primary textbook in a college-level first course in computing.

name: Hacking: The Art of Exploitation, 2nd Edition
author: Nell Dale
description: Revised and updated with the latest information in the field, the Fifth Edition of best-selling Computer Science Illuminated continues to provide students with an engaging breadth-first overview of computer science principles and provides a solid foundation for those continuing their study in this dynamic and exciting discipline.

name: Computer Science: An Overview (12th Edition)
author: Glenn Brookshear
description: Computer Science: An Overview is intended for use in the Introduction to Computer Science course. It is also suitable for all readers interested in a breadth-first introduction to computer science.

name: Computer Science: An Interdisciplinary Approach
author: Robert Sedgewick
description: Robert Sedgewick and Kevin Wayneâ€™s  Computer Science: An Interdisciplinary Approach  is the ideal modern introduction to computer science with Java programming for both students and professionals.

name: How Computers Work: The Evolution of Technology, 10th Edition
author: Ron White
description: Having sold more than 2 million copies over its lifetime, How Computers Work is the definitive illustrated guide to the world of PCs and technology.
